msItem.title: Siyar ul-Muta'akhkhirin.
msItem.note: Folio one recto, stamp, as on Codrington/Reade No 112. On European paper, with watermarks including three top-hats. In many respects uniform with Codrington/Reade No 112, probably, at least in part, written by the same scribe. Entitled Volume II, but contains the third and forth sections of the work as described by Storey, covering the history of India from A.H. 1153 to 1195, and the section on Aurangzib. Part of the same work as Codrington/Reade No 110. Headings and punctuation in red.

bindingDesc.p: Blue cloth Carnegie Trust binding of 1930. The central portion of the original black leather cover is pasted inside the back cover. It has blind-stamped cartouches from the same stamps as used on Codrington/Reade No 112.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org

list.item: History of India, Mughal dynasty, seventeenth and eighteenth centuries.
